pli-tv-pvr12:0.3: 1. Questions and responses on accusing, etc.
pli-tv-pvr12:1.3: What is the purpose of the Sangha?
pli-tv-pvr12:1.4: Why is there the taking of advice?’
pli-tv-pvr12:2.2: The purpose of reminding is restraint;
pli-tv-pvr12:2.3: The purpose of the Sangha is scrutiny,
pli-tv-pvr12:4.3: In line with the discourses and the Monastic Law,
pli-tv-pvr12:4.4: In line with what has been laid down,
pli-tv-pvr12:5.1: Consider carefully the proper procedure of examination,
pli-tv-pvr12:5.2: As formulated by the skilled Awakened One,
pli-tv-pvr12:5.3: Well-spoken in line with the training rules—
pli-tv-pvr12:5.4: Do not destroy your future rebirth.
pli-tv-pvr12:5.5: You should seek what is beneficial,
pli-tv-pvr12:5.6: At the right time, what is connected with the goal.
pli-tv-pvr12:6.1: The statements of the accuser and the accused,
pli-tv-pvr12:6.3: If the accuser says the accused has offended,
pli-tv-pvr12:6.4: But the accused says he has not,
pli-tv-pvr12:7.2: Should be dealt with in line with their admission.
pli-tv-pvr12:7.4: But there is no such things among the shameless;
pli-tv-pvr12:7.5: For even if the shameless should speak a lot,
pli-tv-pvr12:7.6: They should be dealt with in line with their conduct.’
pli-tv-pvr12:8.2: In that an admission is not effective?
pli-tv-pvr12:8.4: What are they like, the people called shameless?
pli-tv-pvr12:9.3: And go to a bad rebirth—
pli-tv-pvr12:10.3: And may I ask you something else:
pli-tv-pvr12:10.4: What are they like, the people called conscientious?’
pli-tv-pvr12:11.3: And they do not go to a bad rebirth—
pli-tv-pvr12:12.3: And may I ask you something else:
pli-tv-pvr12:12.4: What are they like, those who accuse illegitimately?’
pli-tv-pvr12:13.1: ‘They accuse at the wrong time, untruthfully,
pli-tv-pvr12:13.3: They accuse with a mind of ill will, not a mind of good will—
pli-tv-pvr12:13.4: Such a person is called one who accuses illegitimately.’
pli-tv-pvr12:14.2: Such a person is called one who accuses illegitimately.
pli-tv-pvr12:14.3: And may I ask you something else:
pli-tv-pvr12:14.4: What are they like, those who accuse legitimately?’
pli-tv-pvr12:15.1: ‘They accuse at the right time, truthfully,
pli-tv-pvr12:15.3: They accuse with a mind of good will, not a mind of ill will—
pli-tv-pvr12:15.4: Such a person is called one who accuses legitimately.’
pli-tv-pvr12:16.2: Such a person is called one who accuses legitimately.
pli-tv-pvr12:16.3: And may I ask you something else:
pli-tv-pvr12:16.4: What are they like, the people called ignorant accusers?’
pli-tv-pvr12:17.3: They do not know the sequence of statements;
pli-tv-pvr12:17.5: Such people are called ignorant accusers.’
pli-tv-pvr12:18.2: Such people are called ignorant accusers.
pli-tv-pvr12:18.3: And may I ask you something else:
pli-tv-pvr12:18.4: What are they like, the people called learned accusers?’
pli-tv-pvr12:19.3: They know the sequence of statements;
pli-tv-pvr12:19.5: Such people are called learned accusers.’
pli-tv-pvr12:20.2: Such people are called learned accusers.
pli-tv-pvr12:20.3: And may I ask you something else:
pli-tv-pvr12:21.1: ‘One accuses because of failure in morality,
pli-tv-pvr12:21.2: And for failure in conduct and view;
pli-tv-pvr12:21.3: Also one accuses for failure in livelihood—
pli-tv-pvr12:21.4: Because of this it is called accusing.’”
pli-tv-pvr12:22.1: Another collection of verses is finished.
